items.Justification: This paper is about exoplanet detection and characterisation using JWST, which is not directly related to Free Space Optical Communication (FSOC) or the researcher's interests.
This paper focuses on high mass transiting exoplanets and brown dwarfs, which is not relevant to FSOC or the researcher's interests.
This paper presents an experimental demonstration of photonic phase correctors, which is directly relevant to the researcher's interests in adaptive optics and wavefront sensing.
This paper investigates light scrambling and focal ratio degradation of thin multimode fibers, which is tangentially related to FSOC but not a core interest for the researcher.

This paper demonstrates an ultra-fast intensity interferometry instrument using hybrid single photon counting detectors, which is somewhat related to FSOC but not a primary interest for the researcher.
